title: Here is a list of 20 articles that explore how socio-cultural perspectives influence annotation in the context of Natural Language Processing (NLP). This list includes a mix of foundational papers, recent studies, and reviews up to
The social impact of natural language processing
container-title: Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 2: Short Papers).**

title: Discusses the broader social implications of NLP, including annotation
Data Statements for NLP: Toward Mitigating System Bias and Enabling Better Science
container-title: Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics.**

title: Proposes a framework for documenting the socio-cultural context of datasets
Natural Language Annotation for Machine Learning
A comprehensive guide on annotation practices, including socio-cultural considerations
Gender and Dialect Bias in YouTube’s Automatic Captions
container-title: Proceedings of the First ACL Workshop on Ethics in NLP.**

title: Examines biases in automated systems and the role of socio-cultural factors in annotation
Ten Challenges in Natural Language Processing
container-title: Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.**

title: Identifies key challenges in NLP, including socio-cultural biases in annotation

author.literal: **Blodgett, S. L., Barocas, S., Daumé III, H., & Wallach, H.

title: Language (Technology) is Power: A Critical Survey of 'Bias' in NLP
container-title: Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.**

title: A critical review of bias in NLP and its socio-cultural implications

author.literal: **Gebru, T., Morgenstern, J., Vecchione, B., Vaughan, J. W., Wallach, H., Daumé III, H., & Crawford, K.

title: Datasheets for Datasets
Advocates for detailed documentation of datasets, including socio-cultural context
The Risk of Racial Bias in Hate Speech Detection
container-title: Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.**

title: Investigates racial bias in hate speech detection and the role of socio-cultural factors
Racial Bias in Hate Speech and Abusive Language Detection Datasets
container-title: Proceedings of the Third Workshop on Abusive Language Online.**

title: Explores racial bias in datasets and its socio-cultural roots
Releasing a New Dataset for the Study of Abusive Language in Online Discussion
container-title: Proceedings of the First Workshop on Abusive Language Online.**

title: Discusses the creation of a dataset with socio-cultural considerations
Hateful Symbols or Hateful People? Predictive Features for Hate Speech Detection on Twitter
Analyzes socio-cultural features in hate speech detection
Examining Gender and Race Bias in Two Hundred Sentiment Analysis Systems
container-title: Proceedings of the Seventh Joint Conference on Lexical and Computational Semantics.**

title: Studies gender and race bias in sentiment analysis systems
‘It’s Reducing a Human Being to a Percentage’: Perceptions of Justice in Algorithmic Decisions
container-title: Proceedings of the 2018 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems.**

title: Explores perceptions of fairness in algorithmic decisions, including annotation
The Importance of Modeling Social Factors of Language: Theory and Practice
container-title: Proceedings of the 2021 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing.**

title: Emphasizes the importance of socio-cultural factors in language modeling
Incorporating Dialectal Variability for Socially Equitable Language Identification
container-title: Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.**

title: Discusses the inclusion of dialectal variability in language identification
Annotating Hate Speech: The Role of Annotation Guidelines and Annotator Bias
container-title: Proceedings of the 11th Workshop on Computational Approaches to Subjectivity, Sentiment & Social Media Analysis.**

title: Investigates the impact of annotation guidelines and annotator bias
Social Bias Frames: Reasoning about Social and Power Implications of Language
container-title: Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.**

title: Introduces a framework for reasoning about social biases in language
Evaluating Fairness in Pre-trained Language Models
container-title: Proceedings of the 2020 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing.**

title: Evaluates fairness in pre-trained language models with socio-cultural perspectives
Fairness in Machine Learning: Lessons from Political Philosophy
container-title: Proceedings of the 2018 Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency.**

title: Draws lessons from political philosophy for fairness in machine learning, including annotation
Understanding the Socio-Cultural Context in NLP: A Survey
A comprehensive survey on the influence of socio-cultural context in NLP

These articles provide a broad overview of the intersection between socio-cultural perspectives and annotation in NLP, offering insights into biases, fairness, and the importance of context in language processing
